MCQ: Who coined the term machine learning in 1959?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | b: Walter Pitts | c: Arthur Samuel | d: Warren McCulloch

MCQ: What was the early machine learning model introduced by Arthur Samuel in the 1950s?
Choices: a: Calculating winning chance in checkers | b: Analyzing sonar signals | c: Recognizing patterns in speech | d: Classifying data based on models

MCQ: Who proposed the early mathematical models of neural networks for machine learning?
Choices: a: Tom M. Mitchell | b: Donald Hebb | c: Raytheon Company | d: Warren McCulloch

MCQ: What is the objective of modern-day machine learning in classifying data?
Choices: a: To predict future outcomes | b: To analyze electrocardiograms | c: To develop neural structures | d: To make predictions based on models

MCQ: According to Tom M. Mitchell, when does a computer program learn from experience?
Choices: a: When its performance at tasks in T improves with experience E | b: When it is repetitively trained by a human operator/teacher | c: When it is equipped with a 'goof' button | d: When it recognizes patterns in speech
